jobs.title: AI Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our Mission

Casium is building the fastest, most comprehensive business immigration solution. We bring together human expertise and AI innovation to help companies secure top global talent with speed, clarity, and compliance.

Talent is global. But the immigration system wasn’t built for speed, clarity, or scale. Founders wait months to start companies. Engineers lose job offers to visa delays. HR teams drown in compliance paperwork. We’re rebuilding immigration from the ground up using AI, automation, and expert legal oversight - to make filing for a visa as seamless as signing an offer letter.

Why it matters

Immigration is not just paperwork - it’s access. Access to jobs, teams, opportunity. For companies, delays mean lost hires. For individuals, it can mean the end of a dream. We’ve already helped dozens of companies identify how to hire the top talent they want, retain key engineers, and unlock new markets—all while reducing legal spend by 30–50%. We are the bridge between great talent and the opportunities they deserve.

Our customers

We serve top-tier talent and teams, including startup founders from the AI2 Incubator, talent from Meta, Microsoft, and Amazon, and VC-backed companies hiring global operators. We’ve had zero customer churn to date and our customers consistently tell us Casium is the best immigration experience they’ve ever had. We’ve built a reputation for speed, transparency, and care and it shows in our word-of-mouth growth and extremely high approval record to date. We’re just getting started and the demand is already outpacing what we can build.

Our investors

We’re well funded and backed by world-class investors and operators across AI, SaaS, and global mobility who believe the future of innovation depends on global talent and that Casium will power it.

If you want to build fast, own your work end-to-end, and make a real impact on real people’s lives, we’d love to talk. We’re hiring across engineering, legal ops, and growth. Reach out. We’ll show you what we’re building.

About the Role

We are fundamentally an engineering-driven company, and as we enter our next chapter, we're investing deeply in AI-native products to reshape how software empowers businesses. We believe in building full-stack, vertically integrated solutions that redefine high skilled immigration petition workflows through automation, agents, and intelligent interfaces.

We’re looking for an experienced AI Product Engineer to join our early efforts in defining legal processing experiences through an AI-first lens. This role is ideal for a builder who thrives at the intersection of AI capabilities and product experience, someone excited to craft intelligent, user-facing features from the ground up and push the boundaries of what’s possible with LLMs and agentic workflows. This role is at the intersection of AI and product engineering, focused on taking LLMs and agentic workflows from idea → prototype → production. We are building real systems that make immigration faster, more reliable, and less painful for extraordinary people and the companies hiring them.

You’ll work alongside product, engineering, and design to build novel customer-facing products and AI-powered internal tooling. This is a highly cross-functional role with high ownership, a fast feedback loop, and deep impact on how Casium’s processes work.

What You’ll Do

  • Ship new AI-native product experiences across Casium, from 0→1 prototypes to scaled production systems

  • Build LLM-powered agents that autonomously reason through complex workflows

  • Contribute to our evolving AI product stack: prompt orchestration, context engineering, evals, embeddings, and retrieval systems

  • Develop backend services that incorporate AI into user experiences

  • Collaborate closely with AI platform, infra, and design to push the capabilities of our internal and external tooling

  • Stay on the bleeding edge of the AI ecosystem (tools like Claude Code, Cursor, OpenAI Agent SDK, MCPs, etc.) and identify where and how we can adopt emerging techniques

  • Influence Casium’s broader AI product strategy and technical vision

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of professional software engineering experience, with a focus on backend or full-stack work.

  • Demonstrated experience shipping AI-powered product features into production.

  • Comfort working with Python, Postgres, and modern backend frameworks (FastAPI, SQLAlchemy).

  • Fluency with modern LLM platforms, AI-assisted dev tools (Cursor, Claude Code), and prompt/retrieval/orchestration techniques.

  • Bias toward rapid experimentation, balanced by an ability to make systems reliable at scale.

  • Experience with or interest in AI-native workflows (RAG pipelines, vector DBs, LLM observability, evals, agents, dev tooling).

  • A deep interest in being an early adopter of the best AI products and bringing their learnings into Casium

  • Exposure to or interest in frontend development (React/Next.js, TypeScript).

  • Strong product sense and ability to balance correctness with speed.

  • Startup experience or aspiring founder, you want to own outcomes, not just ship tickets.

Why Casium

  • Mission-Driven Impact. Immigration is opaque, expensive, exclusionary. We’re helping extraordinary people stay in the U.S. and build the future.

  • AI is at the core. We’re not bolting AI onto CRUD apps. We’re rethinking an industry from first principles with automation, agents, and intelligent interfaces.

  • Big market, huge stakes. Business immigration is multi-billion and underserved. We’ve already proven demand with paying customers and real growth.

  • Early but de-risked. As an early team member, you will shape the product, culture, and direction of our company. Backed by AI2 Incubator and top-tier VCs/angels, with meaningful early traction.

  • You’ll shape the company. As a founding AI engineer, your fingerprints will be on product, stack, and culture.

  • Hard problems, real impact. Not novelty demos. Applied AI in a domain that demands correctness.

  • Learning opportunities. With AI2 as a co-founder, you’ll have access to world-class researchers, engineers, and a vibrant AI community.

Why You Shouldn’t Join Us

  • You want research papers, not applied systems.

  • You need clean specs handed down from a PM.

  • You prefer safe, predictable environments.

  • You’re uncomfortable with end-to-end ownership and moving quickly.

jobs.title: Staff Founding Engineer [Full Stack]
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our Mission

Casium is building the fastest, most comprehensive business immigration solution. We bring together human expertise and AI innovation to help companies secure top global talent with speed, clarity, and compliance.

Talent is global. But the immigration system wasn’t built for speed, clarity, or scale. Founders wait months to start companies. Engineers lose job offers to visa delays. Why it matters

We’ve already helped dozens of companies identify how to hire the top talent they want, retain key engineers, and unlock new markets—all while reducing legal spend by 30–50%. We are the bridge between great talent and the opportunities they deserve.

Our customers

We serve top-tier talent and teams, including startup founders from the AI2 Incubator, talent from Meta, Microsoft, and Amazon, and VC-backed companies hiring global operators. We’ve had zero customer churn to date and our customers consistently tell us Casium is the best immigration experience they’ve ever had. We’ve built a reputation for speed, transparency, and care and it shows in our word-of-mouth growth and extremely high approval record to date. We’re just getting started and the demand is already outpacing what we can build.

Our investors

We’re well funded and backed by world-class investors and operators across AI, SaaS, and global mobility who believe the future of innovation depends on global talent and that Casium will power it.

If you want to build fast, own your work end-to-end, and make a real impact on real people’s lives, we’d love to talk. We’re hiring across engineering, legal ops, and growth. Reach out. We’ll show you what we’re building.

About the Role

We’re looking for a Founding Generalist Engineer to join Casium at the ground floor. This is a high-ownership role focused on core systems architecture, backend infrastructure, and product logic. We're solving one of the most complex and high-stakes problems in tech: helping extraordinary people navigate a broken immigration system using software, not spreadsheets.

You’ll work directly with our founders, attorneys, and AI researchers to architect the systems that power Casium. If you’ve ever thought, “why does this still work like it’s 1998?” when working with an employer to file for a visa or dealing with legal software, we feel you, and we’re rebuilding it from first principles.

This is a rare opportunity to build foundational tech for an industry that impacts millions of lives but has seen almost no real innovation.

What You’ll Own

  • Architect and build our core backend systems: case pipeline logic, customer workflow infra, document storage and versioning, event systems, and compliance safeguards.

  • Design a structured schema for immigration petitions, evidence generation, and multi-stakeholder collaboration (clients, lawyers, reviewers, employers).

  • Build and scale AI-powered workflows for legal document preparation, expert review, and petition quality control.

  • Interface deeply with LLMs, task queues, and decision engines to replace repetitive manual legal work with deterministic and probabilistic automation.

  • Collaborate across legal, product, and engineering to turn messy policy and paperwork into clean abstractions that scale.

  • Create internal platforms and developer tools to help our team ship high-quality code, faster, safely.

What We’re Looking For

  • 6–10+ years of professional software engineering experience with deep backend chops and a generalist mindset.

  • Proven experience designing and scaling backend architectures in production (bonus if in regulated or high-trust domains like healthcare, finance, or legal).

  • Comfort working with Python (FastAPI, Pydantic, SQLAlchemy), and Cloud environment such as AWS. We value pragmatism over stack purity.

  • Experience building systems that combine human input + AI/ML outputs in reliable, testable ways.

  • High agency and a strong product sense, you know when to slow down for correctness and when to ship scrappy.

  • Thoughtful communicator. Clear written reasoning and clean architectural thinking matter more here than hot takes or whiteboard ping-pong.

  • Startup experience or founder energy - you want to own outcomes, not just ship tickets.

Why Casium

  • We’re building something that matters. Immigration is deeply broken - opaque, expensive, exclusionary. We help the people who build the future stay in the country legally, and we’re doing it with a full-stack, tech-forward approach.

  • The market is huge and underserved. Business immigration is a massive market. We’ve already proven demand with real revenue and rapidly growing customer base.

  • We’re early, but de-risked. Casium is backed by the AI2 Incubator, led by experienced operators, and well-funded by top-tier angels and VCs. You’ll get real equity with real upside.

  • You’ll shape the company. As a founding engineer, your fingerprints will be on our culture, tech stack, and the company’s trajectory. This is not a backseat role.

  • You’ll work on genuinely hard and novel problems - not yet-another CRUD app.

  • You’ll join a team of builders. We are ex-Meta, Microsoft, and LegalPad, a founding team that cares deeply about output and impact.

  • Access to unique learning opportunities. With the Allen Institute for AI (AI2) Incubator as a co-founder, our team gets access to numerous talks by leading AI researchers/paper authors, knowledge sharing amongst the community of hundreds of engineers working for AI2 companies, and much more. As a part of the multi-disciplinary team, you get to interact with people from very different backgrounds (from legal to AI to software engineers).

Why You Shouldn’t Join Us

  • You need a PM to hand you specs. You won’t get one.

  • You want predictable work and tight lanes. We’re still inventing the map.

  • You don’t like talking to users or thinking in first principles.

  • “Fast, high-quality, end-to-end shipping” sounds like a slogan, not a lifestyle.
